Some explanation and background before my question... setting the 
stage if=
 you will:

I have been developing a robot for quite some years now and whi=
le 
doing this have been looking for a suitable neural network engine to 
d=
rive some of the cognitive functions. 

Years back, I learned that the stan=
dard neural network methodology 
will not work because of the need of a tra=
ining set. Good luck 
creating a training set for a mobile robot. So, I dev=
eloped a few 
methods to emulate a training set, effectively evolve the net=
work 
dynamically. But, this had several obvious deficiencies. I soon found=
 
NEAT, rtNEAT, and hyperNEAT. 

From what I understand after reading sever=
al publications and 
experimenting with some established demonstrations, I =
found the the 
NEAT model is quite useful, but also presents several obstac=
les of 
its own. In a physical robot, evolving networks is not very 
practi=
cal. So, after some careful consideration, I came up with a 
solution.

The=
 solution was to have two environments. One drives the robot with 
a basic =
hyperNEAT neural network, while a second environment runs in 
a simulated e=
nvironment. The NEAT in the simulation will be allowed 
to evolve until a t=
hreshold is met for a Fitness improvement. When 
this threshold is achieved=
, that neural network is transitioned to 
the live robot, and the simulatio=
n is given fresh environment data 
from the sensors, and the cycle begins a=
gain. This will allow the 
NEAT to evolve, and still allow for good operati=
on of the robot. 

A lot of this is going to be done in MRDS to minimise co=
mputation in 
the robot, and also take advantage of the physics and other 
=
components of the simulation environment.

This is the model I am going to =
try to implement, which then leads me 
to my question.

Question 1:
I have =
been able to find quite a bit of documentation on the various 
forms of NEA=
T. But, I have been able to find no information on how to 
actually use NEA=
T in code. Perhaps I am not looking in the right 
places. Hopefully you can=
 point me in the right direction. 

Question 2:
Has anybody done any work a=
long this line? I see many projects that 
use NEAT for various organism sim=
ulations and such, but not really 
anything to drive a physical robot. I wo=
uld appreciate any help on 
this.
